noun.description: The practice or business of gathering and narrating news; gossiping.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in William Hazlitt (1778–1830), writer and painter. From news + mongering, after newsmonger<br>early 19th century; earliest use found in George Dyer (1755–1841), author and advocate of political reform. From news + mongering, after newsmonger.
